Poet-King

Munja was the first great ruler of the Paramara dynasty. He was not only a great warrior but also a distinguished poet and patron of scholars. He was called 'Kavi-Vrish' and 'Utpalraja'. Scholars like Dhananjaya, Halayudha, and Dhanika resided in his court.

тЪФя╕П
Struggle with Tailapa

He defeated the Chalukya king Tailapa II of Kalyani six times, but on the seventh attempt, he was captured while crossing the Godavari River and was killed by Tailapa. He constructed the 'Munja Sagar' lake in Dhar (Madhya Pradesh).
